org.jlab.coda.et

Class EtFifo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.coda.et.EtFifo

  • public class EtFifo
extends java.lang.Object

    This class is designed to use an ET system as a FIFO. The idea is that an ET system divides its events (or buffers) into groups (or arrays) of fixed size. Each array is then a single FIFO entry. Thus the FIFO's entries are each an array of related buffers.

    When requesting an entry, this interface does so in arrays of this fixed size. Likewise, when putting them back it does so only in the same arrays. In order to use this interface, the ET system should be run using the et_start_fifo program and not et_start. This sets up the ET to be comprised of properly grouped events. It also creates one station, called "Users" to which the consumers of FIFO entries will attach.

    This interface is intended to be used by connecting to a local C-based ET system using shared memory - providing a fast, wide FIFO available to multiple local processes. Although it could be used by remote users of the ET system, it's advantages would be lost.

    These routines are threadsafe with the exception of getBuffer(int, EtFifoEntry), but that should never be called on the same arg with different threads. These routines are designed to work as follows:

    1. Create an EtSystem object
    2. Call EtSystem.open() to open ET system
    3. Create an EtFifo object as either an entry producer or consumer
    4. Create an EtFifoEntry object
      • Makes sure ET is setup properly
      • Attaches to GrandCentral station if producing entries
      • Attaches to Users station if consuming entries
    5. Call newEntry(EtFifoEntry) or newEntry(EtFifoEntry, int) if producing fifo entry
      • Call EtFifoEntry.getBuffers() to get access to all the events of a single fifo entry
      • Call getEntryCapacity() to get the number of events in array. Need only be done once.
      • Call getBufferSize() to get available size of each event. Need only be done once.
      • Call EtEvent.setFifoId(int) to set an id for a particular event
      • Call EtEvent.setLength(int) to set the size of valid data for a particular event
    6. Call getEntry(EtFifoEntry) or getEntry(EtFifoEntry, int) if consuming fifo entry
      • Call EtFifoEntry.getBuffers() to get access to all the events of a single fifo entry
      • Call getEntryCapacity() to get the number of events in array. Need only be done once.
      • Call getBufferSize() to get available size of each event. Need only be done once.
      • Call EtEvent.setFifoId(int) to set an id for a particular event
      • Call EtEvent.setLength(int) to set the size of valid data for a particular event
    7. Call putEntry(EtFifoEntry) when finished with fifo entry
    8. Call close() when finished with fifo interface
    9. Call EtSystem.close() when finished with ET system

    The first integer of an event's control array is reserved to hold an id to distinguish it from the other events. It's initially set to -1. Note that once you call EtFifoEntry.getBuffers() and get the events, you have full access to the control array of each event by calling EtEvent.getControl() and EtEvent.setControl(int[]) and are not restricted to using EtEvent.getFifoId() and EtEvent.setFifoId(int) which only access the first integer of the control array. The control array is of size EtConstants.stationSelectInts.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EtFifo(EtSystem sys)
      Create a fifo representation of the ET system and interact with it as a consumer of fifo entries.
      EtFifo(EtSystem sys, int[] bufferIds)
      Create a fifo representation of the ET system and interact with it as a producer of fifo entries.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EtFifo

        public EtFifo(EtSystem sys)
       throws java.io.IOException,
              org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException,
              org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtClosedException,
              org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtDeadException,
              org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtTooManyException
        Create a fifo representation of the ET system and interact with it as a consumer of fifo entries.
        Parameters:
        sys - object representing an open ET system.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if network communication error.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if ET system is improperly setup (no \"Users\" station). If ET system has more than 2 stations.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtClosedException - if EtSystem.close() has been called to close connection to ET.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtDeadException - if ET system is dead.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtTooManyException - if cannot attach to ET station due to max number of such attachments already made.

      • EtFifo

        public EtFifo(EtSystem sys,
              int[] bufferIds)
       throws java.io.IOException,
              org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException,
              org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtClosedException,
              org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtDeadException,
              org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtTooManyException
        Create a fifo representation of the ET system and interact with it as a producer of fifo entries.
        Parameters:
        sys - object representing an open ET system.
        bufferIds - array of expected source ids of data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if network communication error.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if ET system is improperly setup. If bufferIds arg is null or 0 length, or is too large (in which case ET needs to be created with more buffers in fifo entry). If ET system has more than 2 stations.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtClosedException - if EtSystem.close() has been called to close connection to ET.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtDeadException - if ET system is dead.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtTooManyException - if cannot attach to ET station due to max number of such attachments already made.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Close this object, which is just a detach from an ET station. Closing the ET system must be done separately.

      • newEntry

        public void newEntry(EtFifoEntry entry)
              throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException,
                     org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtDeadException,
                     org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtClosedException,
                     org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtWakeUpException,
                     java.io.IOException
        This routine is called when a user wants an array of related, empty buffers from the ET system into which data can be placed. This routine will block until the buffers become available. Access the buffers by calling EtFifoEntry.getBuffers(). Each call to this routine MUST be accompanied by a following call to putEntry(EtFifoEntry)!
        Parameters:
        entry - fifo entry to be filled with new events.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if problems with network communications.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if called by consumer, or if thread calling this is interrupted while reading from socket, or attachment not active, or did not get the full number of buffers comprising one fifo entry, or for other general errors.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtDeadException - if the ET system processes are dead.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtClosedException - if the ET system is closed.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtWakeUpException - if the attachment has been commanded to wakeup.
        See Also:
        EtSystem.newEvents(EtContainer)

      • newEntry

        public void newEntry(EtFifoEntry entry,
                     int microSec)
              throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException,
                     org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtDeadException,
                     org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtClosedException,
                     org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtTimeoutException,
                     org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtWakeUpException,
                     java.io.IOException
        This routine is called when a user wants an array of related, empty buffers from the ET system into which data can be placed. This routine will block until it times out. Access the buffers by calling EtFifoEntry.getBuffers(). Each call to this routine MUST be accompanied by a following call to putEntry(org.jlab.coda.et.EtFifoEntry)!
        Parameters:
        entry - fifo entry to be filled with new events.
        microSec - time to wait before returning.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if problems with network communications.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if called by consumer, or if thread calling this is interrupted while reading from socket, or attachment not active, or did not get the full number of buffers comprising one fifo entry, or for other general errors.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtDeadException - if the ET system processes are dead.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtClosedException - if the ET system is closed.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtWakeUpException - if the attachment has been commanded to wakeup.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtTimeoutException - if the given time has expired (never thrown if microsec = 0).
        See Also:
        EtSystem.newEvents(EtContainer)

      • getEntry

        public void getEntry(EtFifoEntry entry,
                     int microSec)
              throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException,
                     org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtDeadException,
                     org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtClosedException,
                     org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtTimeoutException,
                     org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtWakeUpException,
                     java.io.IOException
        This routine is called when a user wants an array of related, data-filled buffers from the ET system. This routine will block until it times out. Access the buffers by calling EtFifoEntry.getBuffers(). Each call to this routine MUST be accompanied by a following call to putEntry(org.jlab.coda.et.EtFifoEntry)!
        Parameters:
        entry - fifo entry to be filled with events.
        microSec - time to wait before returning.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if problems with network communications.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if called by consumer, or if bad arg, or if thread calling this is interrupted while reading from socket, or attachment not active, or did not get the full number of buffers comprising one fifo entry, or for other general errors.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtDeadException - if the ET system processes are dead.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtClosedException - if the ET system is closed.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtWakeUpException - if the attachment has been commanded to wakeup.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtTimeoutException - if the given time has expired (never thrown if microsec = 0).
        See Also:
        EtSystem.getEvents(EtContainer)

      • putEntry

        public void putEntry(EtFifoEntry entry)
              throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException,
                     org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtDeadException,
                     org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtClosedException,
                     java.io.IOException
        This routine is called when a user wants to place an array of related, data-filled buffers (single FIFO entry) back into the ET system. This must be called after calling either getEntry(EtFifoEntry), getEntry(EtFifoEntry, int) , newEntry(EtFifoEntry) , or newEntry(EtFifoEntry, int) . This routine will never block.
        Parameters:
        entry - fifo entry with events to be returned to ET.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if problems with network communications.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - or attachment not active, or for other general errors.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtDeadException - if the ET system processes are dead.
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtClosedException - if the ET system is closed.
        See Also:
        EtSystem.putEvents(EtContainer)

      • isProducer

        public boolean isProducer()
        Does this ET-fifo user produce fifo entries?
        Returns:
        true if this ET-fifo user produces fifo entries, else false if it consumes fifo entries.

      • getBufferSize

        public long getBufferSize()
        Gets the size of each event's data buffer in bytes.
        Returns:
        size of each event's data buffer in bytes.

      • getEntryCapacity

        public int getEntryCapacity()
        Gets the max number of events in each FIFO entry.
        Returns:
        max number of events in each FIFO entry.

      • getIdCount

        public int getIdCount()
        Gets the number of buffers assigned an id in each FIFO entry.
        Returns:
        number of buffers assigned an id in each FIFO entry.

      • getBufferIds

        public int[] getBufferIds()
        Gets the array of ids assigned to buffers in each FIFO entry. The same as constructors' bufferIds argument.

        The returned array is not a copy, so don't change values!

        Returns:
        number of buffers assigned an id in each FIFO entry, or ET_ERROR if bad arg(s).

      • getBuffer

        public static EtEvent getBuffer(int id,
                                EtFifoEntry entry)
        Find the event/buffer in the fifo entry corresponding to the given id. If none, get the first unused buffer, assign it that id, and return it. The id value for an event is stored in its first control integer. NOT threadsafe.
        Parameters:
        id - id.
        entry - fifo entry with events to be searched.
        Returns:
        buffer labelled with id or first one that's unused. NULL if no bufs are available.
